textLines: This water looks fresh enough. Its not like I'm going to be able to get a drink anywhere else so I might as well drink now.
Here goes.
Suprisingly good 水. This might not be so bad of a place.
My お腹...
What is this...
These are... 雲? And this island is floating?
What a beautiful looking fruit. What a shame that it's in such a suspicious pla-
*groooooooooooooowl*
... Alright fine, I'll take 一つ.
Here it is... the dark, suspicious stairs. Just what I needed. I guess I should probably go down there though, there might be something important.
Who knows, maybe even a person, this place looks tended to after all.
It can't be that bad, let's just take a peep. You can do it, you can do it, you can do it...
Abort, abort, abort, have to run... why did it have to be this close to the entrance???
Ow... why does it have to attack me???

An enemy has made contact, so you are now in combat. When you make an action, the enemy will also have a chance to take an action, so choose wisely. Although, you can only run and press Z for a normal attack, right now.
Fortunately, you are still right by the stairs, so you can use it to escape.
This time I won't let it attack me first!
Ow... that stung, what was that? It felt like some force was interfering with my thoughts.
I should keep looking around the island.
It happened again... I have a feeling its going to keep happening.
I should keep looking around the island.
That hurt as usual, there has to be something that'll help me around here though.
I should keep looking around the island.
I can feel it... aside from the pain. I'm getting something out of this. And I feel close to being able to figure out a way to control this a little.
I should keep looking around and try and make that happen one more time.
I feel an unfamiliar power. And I think I know how to use it somehow.
Before doing anything else, it might be a good idea to use this up first.
(Try looking in the abilities tab in the menu).
Where... am I?
Thirsty... hungry... and something else feels off too. Something unpleasant.
Let's look around for now, at least a little bit.
Hello playerName, how are you doing on this fine spring day?
Great!
Hey its nobody here here to say: no body!!!! hahahahah ahahahaha. i lied, im not nobody, im the devil of arch-hunger.
I Will Eat You !
I wonder how far up this is in the sky? It's impossible to tell from here.
The bristling water is beautiful. I've got a lot of other things to worry about than that right now though.
A lone sunflower in a place like this? Looks amazingly healthy but no seeds, strange.
No painful thought-interference this time? Thats a relief, but I wonder what causes it...
I'll leave the rest of these alone for now, somehow I have a feeling someone will be mad.
What a suspiciously placed bush.
Just for me!
Not bad.
Ugh.......... my head...

lineInfo.altText: Even though I'm just walking around, it's here again... ugh...

textLines: It's coming.
Time to show this thing what's boss. Focus...
Succeed in capturing all the following kanji and the ability is yours! And don't worry, if you fail, you can try again as many times as you want. You'll probably have to try several times.
Ugh, I didn't quite get it this time. I know I can do it though. Should I try again?
I think I managed to get it this time! There's no way this won't help.
Make sure to remember to equip it in the menu!
Sometimes the symbols popping up in my head can get annoying. I feel like I should be able to stop it from coming altogether when I don't want it. Let's try it...
Ugh, I didn't quite get it this time. Should I try again?
Managed to get it down! It's kind of tiring to use but might be alright from time to time.
That green snake is really dangerous. What if I strengthened my body to be able to stomp it a lot harder? Worth a try.
Ugh, I didn't quite get it this time. Should I try again?
Not bad.
This entire time I'm needing to deal with a limit on how much power I can store... I think I might be able to deal with that.
Ugh, I didn't quite get it this time. Should I try again?
There we go! I should be able to learn a lot of new things now.
I feel something familiar about these berries I've been finding. Somehow I think using my power on the bushes might be worth a try at least.
Without some focus and practice though it isn't going to work out.
Ugh, I didn't quite get it this time. Should I try again?
Maybe I should find a bush to try this out on.

kanji.story: The one is written sideways.
1 and 1 makes 2.
1 and 1 and 1 makes 3.
Three with two extra vertical lines 2+3=5.
It's upside down, and crossed european style, but definitely a 7.
It's upside down, and crossed european style, but definitely a 7.
It's all within 4 walls.
The one is written sideways.
If you use a crude approximation of pi, the circle doesn't go all the way around.
Three lines pointing out from a central intersection, and a line halved: six can be halved or divided by three.
A roof over a chasm; holes in the ground are dangerous, and should be covered like this one.
A bit of the unenclosed shapes of four and five: 4+5=9.
Nine with one more to round off.
A left hand pressing downward so powerfully that the fingers are bent back.
This evolved from the ancient swastika, which once meant ten-thousand gods. It kept its four arms, but only one maintains the swirl.
An old man, leaning on a cane, wearing a hat, who is lost and asking directions.
The curved blade, chisel point, and cross-guard of a Japanese-style knife.
A knife with the non-edge side crossed out.
A one with a vertical cross to indicate that it is moved to a higher decimal position, making ten.
Ten cubed is a thousand (the three lines indicate 3 dimensions).
Something growing from the earth.
An important person who can muster at least ten soliers from their land.
Your knight got all wet? Just hang them upside down to dry off!
A carpenter's ruler..
Pointing up from the base.
Pointing down from the crossbeams of the ceiling.
Standing on two legs.
Two streams flow together, the smaller entering the larger.
Flames flicker over the woodpile.
Two fingers picking up a small pin.
A person with arms outstretched to indicate something big.
The person from big is disconnecting their leg so they can hold it and show how long it is.
A simple picture of a tree trunk and branches.
The tree grows from the root. What it grows from is its origin.
The top tip of the tree is made big to show that's what we are talking about.
Ungrown tip: The top tip of the tree is made small to show that it has not yet grown.
The big person is trying to show how big the heavens are, but it's above them and bigger than their arms can show.
When the heavens are out of joint, something terrible will happen.
Some trees in the woods.
Many trees in the forest.
Double fire means flames.
Ten (left) with triple power (right) shows how many working together accomplish three times what they could do alone.
Craft (left) and power (right): quality and utility taken together mean merit.
A person (left) serving a knight (right).
Basic character. Use two lines (X axis and Y axis) to measure the dot (on the graph).
Like gold, silver is a metal.
When you stab something you often leave a big (bottom) hole (top).
Body is the origin of a human, just like a book is the origin of knowledge.
You can see the sun shining through this window.
The sun rises early, well before ten.
Any change of state, like a change from standing up to sitting down.
Radicals: grass + change. The flower is the essence of change, changing throughout its growth and with the seasons.
Basic character. I see it as a pictograph of a sprout growing up from the ground, symbolizing fresh life.

theory.title: Welcome to currently unnamed kanji learning game!
theory.description: Learn about the very basics of this game.
theory.unlockText: Be an absolutely wonderful human being!

unlockRequirements.textDescription: Be an absolutely wonderful human being!

pages:
Welcome to currently unnamed kanji learning game! Let's review the basic controls: 
 
 Use the arrow keys to move around. Press Z to interact with things in front of you. Try interacting with a lot of things! Hover your mouse over items and conditions for information on them. You might have to use the rest of your keyboard to type at times. I wonder what that dysymbolia thing is all about? 
 
 Hope you liked those 5 gems I gave you, they are very pretty. If you want more, try unlocking more theory pages! I explain what this theory tab is all about in the next page. You could read it if you want. Or you could just grab the gems and leave without reading it, I won't judge (maybe just a little bit). 
 
 - Sarracenia

theory.title: What is this theory tab?
theory.description: Learn what this menu tab is for and how to use it.
pages:
What is this theory tab, you ask? I'm glad you asked. Wait, before you keep reading! You don't have to read this! You can take the gems and do literally anything else you want to do instead! This tab will be unlocked for all of time for you so come back whenever you want, well, unless you start a new save, or lose this one (I'll do my best to try to make sure that doesn't happen). You could also just never come back. 
 
 The point is, you could skip these and be fine, and you definitely don't have to read them in order. In the theory tab you are on right now, you unlock my write-ups in English and you can read whichever ones you are interested in, either way you can get cool rewards so its a win-win.

You'll unlock write-ups about a variety of topics: 
 - How to use certain game features and tips and tricks for using them. 
 - The point behind the different aspects in the game and why they are designed the way they are for you to help you best learn Japanese, and tips and tricks for making the most out of them for your personal language learning journey and goals 
 - How I suggest you learn Japanese in general. 
 - My own explainations for basic grammar topics in Japanese in case you don't feel like finding a different resource for that which I may or may not help you find! 
 - Plus more, maybe? 
 
 Also at the bottom of the tab is a special section that can help you in the game if you don't know what to do next. You unlocked it by also unlocking this write-up. At least, if I bothered to implement that yet lol. (I haven't.) 
 
 See you in the next one, or not! 
 
 - Sarracenia

theory.title: Why am I learning kanji like this?
theory.description: Learn why this is the best way for you to learn kanji.
pages:
Because I said so lol. 
 
 - Sarracenia

Okay okay, I'll give you a real answer if you want it that bad. There are a lot of parts to the full answer to this question, because of all the different features in the game which are there to help you learn efficiently. The explainations for some of the smaller scale features will be given in other write-ups you won't unlock until later. But there are two larger concepts you will want to understand first of all. First, why you are learning to be able to give english keywords that denotes the meaning of the kanji (page 3), second, why does the game teach those the way it does (premade mnemonics with a spaced repetition system, page 4).

The reason why you are learning to be able to produce english meanings in responce to the kanji, instead of producing the kanji in responce to the meaning, or being able to produce the reading of the kanji, is simply that it is the easiest out of those. What is most important is not in fact, the meaning you learned (although it can help), but the fact that you can recognize the kanji at all. If you want to, you can actually type in a reading of the kanji instead of the meaning and that will work too! (Feature pending, but it needs to exist.) This is because if you can't recognize the most common kanji first, learning how to read japanese which can already be difficult at the beginning becomes much more difficult. This game will provide a way to start your first reading practice, but the kanji study comes first! You'll also be able to learn words easier and even be able to skim through japanese text and possibly understand the meanings of words you don't know without even looking up the words in the dicitionary if you want!

So, how does the game work to teach you the english meanings of kanji? Well, it uses spaced repetition and gives you premade mnemonics, which are stories that connect the strokes of the kanji to the meaning and are designed as scaffolding that has a high chance of being completely forgotten later on but while you are initially learning, will be very useful to you. I could give a long winded explaination of how the visual memory works and how strong it is and whatnot, but I think its easy enough to intuitively understand how useful they can be when you try and use them. My only suggestion with those is that you spend some time to really see the image in your mind and utilize as many senses as you can to produce a vivid image when trying to learn a kanji with these stories. It will help you remember them signiciantly better than you would just reading them, I guarantee it. 
 
 There will be times when the stories don't work out for you. In that case, go ahead and replace the story in the kanji list (feature pending). The stories are compiled to my tastes and based mostly on stories found on Kanji Koohii (look it up!), but I only provide a single story for each kanji because I find that providing multiple stories makes it easy to confuse them which makes it a lot harder to remember the kanji. Send me feedback if you think a different story would be better to provide as the default for a specfic kanji, I'm open to that kind of thing.

Good luck and have fun with your learning! 
 
 - Sarracenia

theory.title: What happens when I get a kanji right on the first try?

unlockRequirements.textDescription: Get a kanji right on the first try!

pages:
Look at you, knowing a thing or two about kanji! Amazing job, you are so smart! Come to think of it, maybe it wouldn't have been too hard to get the kanji for 'three' right on your first try, now would it. But still, congrats. 
 
 Now, what happens is not that complicated really, you won't see it again in a SRS trial unless you come across it and get it wrong somewhere else. The kanji's mastery stage won't jump up to match your 'true' mastery at first, but don't worry, I'll remember that you got it on the first try and later on in the game, when you unlock the ability to jump mastery level by getting a kanji on the first try, all those kanji will be automatically increased in mastery alongside without you doing anything. I just didn't want to give you all those free mastery levels at first! Sorry! 
 
 - Sarracenia

theory.title: What is the point of disabling kanji?
theory.description: Learn about leeches and leech detection.
pages:
I see you've been hard at work studying kanji. Good job. 
 
  What's that? You're a failure? Now now, you don't need to say such things! Not being able to remember is a part of the process, I'm sure you understand. But getting the same kanji wrong over and over can be really frustrating, can't it? That's why I went ahead and disabled a kanji for you for now! That way you can avoid the frustration. You can go to the kanji list and turn it back on whenever you want, or modify or disable this feature in settings if you don't like it. 
 
 I don't recommend disabiling it if you aren't sure though. I didn't just do it just to make you feel better, theres actually very, very good reasons for doing this to further your learning. I'm sure you have noticed that certain kanji just happen to be really easy for you to remember, and some others just won't click, right? It's fun and productive to work on the kanji that is efficient to learn and to continue looking at new kanji, but it's not really fun, productive, or especially beneficial to continue to try and brute force your way towards trying to remember something that just won't click as well. That's why what I recommend is to keep kanji disabled that were automatically disabled for a while, then go back and undisable the ones you think you are ready to introduce. You can also use a (unimplemented) setting to automatically have me turn on kanji that was automatically disabled after it has been a while.

Be warned though, when a kanji is disabled, it can still appear in some places. You can't get it from regular kanji trials, but special trials, like certain trials in combat or in ability acqusition, can still feature that kanji! I don't want that to stop you from disabiling some kanji as you can still get away with not having memorized every single kanji beforehand but still, but it might be difficult if you disable too many kanji so be warned. 
 
 Go ahead and try managing the enabling and disabling of kanji yourself if you think that'll help, or leave it to me if it's bothersome. But either way, good luck on your adventure! 
 
 - Sarracenia

theory.title: Creating an effective study schedule.
theory.description: Learn about how play sessions work and suggestions for using them.

unlockRequirements.textDescription: Achieve mastery level 2 on any kanji.

pages:
Level 2, what an achievement! Well, you've actually just started out to be honest, but its something at least. It means you played this game on two seperate days, or at least I hope so. It might be about time to learn about where this game fits into your schedule in order to best learn kanji. 
 
 If you are experienced with spaced repetition, you already know this, but the best way to use spaced repetition to learn is to come back every day and do your scheduled reviews on time, since if you miss your scheduled reviews it will disrupt the review schedule the system has planned out and interfere with learning. However! Unlike some other (bad) spaced repetition systems out there (don't want to name names but they exist...), there are some features in place that stop everything from exploding and being terrible just because you missed a day or two.

I suggest trying to play every day that you can and at least getting all or most of the reviews out of the way, if you can just do that you'll be getting the most effectiveness for your time. And I wouldn't worry about playing *every* day but leaving it alone for too long will require some effort to get back to where you were. That's it for now, explainations about the vacation features and other tips pending. 
 
 - Sarracenia

abilities.name: Basic Dysymbolia Mastery
abilities.jpName: ディシンボリアの基本制御
abilities.jpNameWithSeperators: ディシンボリア+の+基本+制御
abilities.description:
Through experience with how it works and exerting some internal control, you are able to tame your dysymbolia a little. 
 
 Equipping this passive ability increases your curse resistance by 10% and doubles the time between automatic dysymbolia triggers, but more importantly, after acquiring this ability, you can trigger dysymbolia by clicking the dysymbolia condition without even equpping this.

unlockRequirements.textDescription: Find the abilities menu tab! (Difficulty: Impossible)

abilities.name: Suppress Dysymbolia
abilities.description: Equipping this removes the dysymbolia condition, reduces your max HP by 10%, and disables all dysymbolia abilities, until it is unequipped.

abilities.name: Body Strengthen
abilities.description:
Channel your power towards strengthening your physical abilities. 
 
 When equipped, increases your max hp by 20% and your basic attack strength by 50%. Also, just having it acquired increases your base attack damage by 1.

abilities.name: Limit Break
abilities.description: Channel your dysymbolia power in on itself and use it to increase your maximum dysymbolia power.

abilities.name: Dysymbolia Touch
abilities.description:
You managed to power up your touch at least. 
 
 -Channel 2-, then deal damage based on the result.

abilities.name: Dysymbolia-induced Growth
abilities.jpName: ディシンボリア超生長
abilities.jpNameWithSeperators: ディシンボリア+超+生長
abilities.description:
Only seems to work on some plants and has unusual results, not like natural growth. But it may be helpful? 
 
 -Channel 4-, then attempt to induce growth in a plant. A better channel result will lead to a greater likelihood of getting a rarer or more desirable growth result.

items.name: Love Fruit
items.desc: A mysterious fruit shaped like a heart. Like everything else on this floating island, it looks too good to be true. Heals $healAmount$ HP when consumed and fills you up somewhat. (Double click to use items!).

items.name: Red Berries
items.desc: Some berries you found on the floating island. They don't look like much but they are the best berries you have ever tasted. Heals $healAmount$ HP when consumed and fills you up a little.

items.name: Blue Berries
items.desc: Not to be confused with blueberries. Halves the damage of the next hit you take, to a maximum of 20 damage prevented.

items.name: Yellow Berries
items.desc: Tastes a little funny but maybe you could get used to it. Decreases the time remaining on your temporary negative conditions.

items.name: Some Gun
items.desc: The game messed up and tried to give you an invalid item so take this gun instead.

conditions.name: Dysymbolia
conditions.desc: Character sees visions of a distant world. Next in $timeUntilDysymbolia$, or when ???.

conditions.name: Starvation
conditions.desc: Character is very, very hungry. Healing from most non-food sources is greatly reduced and is taking passive damage.

conditions.name: Hunger
conditions.desc: Character is hungry. Healing from most non-food sources is reduced.

conditions.name: Lizard Toxin
conditions.desc: Character poisoned with a small lizards' toxin. It doesn't make you feel *too* sick and wears off quickly but care still advised. Losing a small amount of HP and brings character closer to hunger. $turnsLeft$ turns left.

actions.name: bite
actions.text: Green Lizard bit Mari dealing {damage} damage!

actions.name: toxic tongue
actions.text: Green Lizard used its toxic tongue dealing {damage} damage and poisoning Mari!
